Hello!

I’m not sure how to start, so I’ll try to keep this short and to the point. :)

Many of the developers here love your contributions to the web community. As such, we were hoping that you might be able to help us out.

We’re trying to make a case to the higher ups to allow us to use Angular in some of our new applications. We’ve written a medium-sized proof-of-concept where we took one of our more complicated components and rewrote it using Angular/Breeze/EF – we saw a 90% savings in the number of lines of code and were able to accomplish this in a matter of hours. Though our boss’s bosses were slightly impressed, they want more concrete numbers on a much larger scale.

We were hoping that you might have some knowledge of this… What we’re looking for is:

  1. Have you worked on an application where Angular was used and what was the time savings on it compared to that same application using ASP.NET MVC or ASP.NET Web Forms).
  2. On that same application, what was the savings in the amount of code that was written? Is there a metric available for maintenance cost savings because of the smaller code base?

We need to provide as concrete numbers as possible from real businesses that have switched to Angular/Breeze/EF.

If there’s anything at all you could do to help us here, we’d greatly appreciate it.
